DOCNAME: CASE OF VOLKAN ÖZDEMİR v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 3 (substantive aspect);Violation of Art. 3 (procedural aspect);Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Elisabet Fura;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , together with Mr Z.K. , was arrested by police officers at the ORG and taken into police custody on suspicion of committing robbery .

CARDINAL . According to the record of the arrest , drafted by CARDINAL police officers on DATE at TIME and signed by the applicant and PERSON , the police had received information that at TIME persons had been seen trying to break into CARDINAL different houses in PERSON . A unit was dispatched and at TIME arrested the suspects , who corresponded to the description given by eyewitnesses ; in the course of the arrest , the applicant had sustained various injuries to his knees , back and forehead since he had fallen on stony ground while he was running .
CARDINAL . On DATE ( DATE ) at TIME an eyewitness identified the applicant and PERSON in the course of an identification parade .
CARDINAL . According to a verbatim report , the applicant was not questioned since he was a minor .

CARDINAL . In the application form the applicant submitted , in great detail , that he had been subjected to various forms of ill - treatment while he was held in police custody . In particular , he submitted that he had been taken to an interrogation room where CARDINAL part of the wall was covered with sponge and that the officers had hit his head against this wall . He claimed that , in this room , he had been beaten and threatened , for example with electric shocks , by CARDINAL plain - clothed police officers . He stated that , although he was blindfolded , he was able to see at CARDINAL point and recognised them from their voices . The applicant further stated that the officers had later made him take a cold shower , stripped him naked and tied his hands . He claimed that all this had taken place at ORG central police station and not at the ORG Erçin police station , where he had been taken for certain procedures before being brought before the court .

CARDINAL . At TIME the applicant was examined by a doctor at the PERSON medical clinic , Mr PERSON , who found that he had a QUANTITY slight skin lesion and oedema on his head , an elliptical area of redness of QUANTITY in the middle of his back resulting from rubbing or hitting , a slight bruise on the back towards the right shoulder and a slight abrasion on the right knee due to rubbing .

CARDINAL . On DATE , at TIME , the applicant was examined by a doctor , PERSON , at the PERSON medical clinic , who found that he had an old bruise of QUANTITY by QUANTITY in the middle of his back . The doctor considered it to be DATE .

CARDINAL . According to the undated rights of suspects and accused form signed by the applicant and a police officer at the ORG Erçin police station , the latter was arrested at TIME However , according to the transfer / release form , dated DATE , the applicant was arrested by ORG on DATE at TIME and released on DATE at TIME According to a report ( fezleke ) prepared by the police , on DATE , the applicant and Mr GPE were arrested at TIME by police officers from ORG ( PERSON ) . In this report it is stated that at TIME on DATE PERSON arrived at the police station to complain about the theft .

CARDINAL . It appears that on DATE the police attempted to bring the applicant before the prosecutor and a judge . However , since it was too late , the prosecutor ordered the applicant to be brought before him early the next day . The applicant was transferred to ORG to be detained .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was first brought before the GPE public prosecutor ’s office and later before ORG , where he denied the accusations against him . The applicant was represented by a lawyer appointed by the Bar . The court remanded him in custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE public prosecutor filed a bill of indictment with ORG , accusing the applicant and PERSON of theft on DATE and of attempted theft on DATE in CARDINAL different houses . The charges were brought under Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW .

CARDINAL . Criminal proceedings were instigated against the applicant and Mr GPE before ORG . At the hearing held on DATE the applicant stated that he did not know what PERSON had been doing during the first attempted theft and had only understood during the second attempted theft . The applicant , who was represented by a lawyer , maintained that he had never entered anyone ’s house or stolen anything and that at the time of the events , once he had understood what his friend was doing during the second attempted theft , on being told to run he had done so . The court ordered the release of Mr GPE and the applicant pending trial .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an official complaint with the GPE public prosecutor ’s office against CARDINAL police officers , whom he believed to be working at the PERSON police station . In his complaint , the applicant submitted that at that police station he had received punches and kicks to his stomach , his head had been hit against a wall and he had been stripped naked , hosed with cold water , threatened with electric shocks and made to wait in the cold . He further complained that he had been unlawfully deprived of his liberty , since he had been arrested at TIME on DATE but brought before a judge only on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE public prosecutor Mr GPE decided not to prosecute CARDINAL police officers from the PERSON police station , CARDINAL police officers from ORG and QUANTITY police officers from ORG on the ground that there was no evidence to substantiate the applicant ’s allegations of ill - treatment . In particular , the prosecutor , referring to the record of the arrest , considered that the findings of the medical report were consistent with the injuries sustained by the applicant when he had fallen during his arrest . He further noted that the medical report had stated that these bruises were old .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant objected to the above decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s objection concerning the alleged ill - treatment . In this connection , it held that , apart from the bruises sustained by the applicant while he had been running from the police and had fallen , there was no physical evidence of ill - treatment . On the other hand , it upheld the applicant ’s objection regarding his deprivation of liberty on the ground that the applicant DATE a minor – had been brought before the prosecutor at TIME on DATE , whereas the prosecutor had asked at TIME that he be brought before him immediately . The court therefore decided that criminal proceedings should be instigated against the police officers for abuse of their position . That decision was served on the applicant ’s lawyer on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . In the meantime the Security Directorate initiated a disciplinary inquiry into the applicant ’s allegations of wrongful deprivation of liberty as regards the length of his detention . On DATE ORG , relying on the evidence in the case file , including the statements by the applicant and his mother , found that there was no need to impose a disciplinary penalty on the CARDINAL accused police officers from ORG . That decision was served on the applicant ’s lawyer on DATE .

CARDINAL . At a hearing held on DATE the first - instance court heard evidence from the applicant . He submitted that he had been beaten at the police station by CARDINAL dark - skinned police officer and that there had been others next to him . The applicant asserted that if he saw them he would be able to recognise them . He further stated that he had not lodged a complaint against the police officers .
CARDINAL . In DATE the first - instance court acquitted the police officers . The applicant appealed . The case is pending before ORG .
